summary: Email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding a request for a Bill of Particulars in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The document includes a draft response from the government and shows communication between legal teams.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell who sends a request for a Bill of Particulars to the prosecution team.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Defense attorney cc'd on the Bill of Particulars request email from Christian Everdell.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney cc'd on the Bill of Particulars request email from Christian Everdell.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney listed in the email thread regarding the Bill of Particulars request.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney listed in the email thread regarding the Bill of Particulars request.

events.title: Defense Request for Bill of Particulars
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell sends a formal request for a Bill of Particulars to the prosecution team.

events.title: Government Draft Response to Bill of Particulars
events.description: Prosecution team circulates a draft response to the defense's request for a Bill of Particulars.

keyFacts: The document shows ongoing pre-trial legal proceedings in the Ghislaine Maxwell case in December 2020-January 2021.
Defense attorney Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP is leading the request for a Bill of Particulars from the prosecution.
The defense legal team includes Mark S. Cohen, Laura Menninger, Bobbi Sternheim, and Jeff Pagliuca.
The prosecution team (USANYS - U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) is preparing a response to the defense's request.
The email includes confidentiality notices and indicates the sensitive nature of the legal communications.
